File libsrc/libgODBC/ODBCGetTableCols.c

ODBCGetTableCols is used by ODBCGetSchema to retrieve information about tables that are available to the current ODBC connection. Information about tables that are synonyms may not be retrievable. The ODBC_Column structure is defined as: 
   typedef struct
   {
       SQLCHAR         catalog[ODBC_STRLEN];
       SQLCHAR         schema[ODBC_STRLEN];
       SQLCHAR         tableName[ODBC_STRLEN];
       SQLCHAR         columnName[ODBC_STRLEN];
       SQLSMALLINT     dataType;
       SQLCHAR         typeName[ODBC_STRLEN];
       SQLINTEGER      columnSize;
       SQLINTEGER      bufferLength;
       SQLSMALLINT     decimalDigits;
       SQLSMALLINT     numPrecRadix;
       SQLSMALLINT     nullable;
       SQLCHAR         remarks[ODBC_REMLEN];
       SQLCHAR         columnDefault[ODBC_STRLEN];
       SQLSMALLINT     sqlDataType;
       SQLSMALLINT     datetimeSubtypeCode;
       SQLINTEGER      charOctetLength;
       SQLINTEGER      ordinalPosition;
       SQLCHAR         isNullable[ODBC_STRLEN];
   } ODBC_Column;

Public Functions

ODBCGetTableCols 
 int ODBCGetTableCols(SQLHDBC hdbc,
                      const char *catalogName,
                      const char *schemaName,
                      const char *tableName,
                      int *numColumns,
                      ODBC_Column **columns)
Get information about the columns of a table. If NULL the current username is used.

Parameters:
hdbc - A connection handle obtained from ODBCConnect().
catalogName - The name of the catalog containing this table.
schemaName - The name of the schema containing this table.
tableName - The name of the database table.
numColumns - The number of columns in the table (returned).
columns - An array of numColumns ODBC_Column structures that describe the columns.
Returns:
0 for success, -1 for an error flag. Retrieve the error number and error message with ODBCErrno() and ODBCErrMsg().
